full_text: Page 3756 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-G DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 1209 1210 b(6); b(7)(C) 8:00-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1241 1242 8:30- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 1 11 1 12 9:00-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 137 138 9:30-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 207 208 10:00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 241 242 10:30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 304 308 11:00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 313 314 11:30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 416 417 12:00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 440 441 12:30- 1:00 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 5:00-5:30 AM 508 509 1:00-1:30 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 541 542 1:30-2:00 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 610 611 2:00-2:30 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM 11:30-12:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT b(6); b(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00027071

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-G DATE: 08/10/2019
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries and redactions. The document is a 30-minute check sheet for inmates in a special housing unit.
